text: {"grade": 1, "reasoning": "The criterion states that the response fails if it 'states that only courts, not arbitral tribunals, can decide jurisdictional validity, ignoring the competence-competence principle'. The candidate answer explicitly and correctly argues the opposite: it dedicates Section I.1 to the 'Deference to the Arbitral Tribunal\u2019s Jurisdictional Rulings (Kompetenz-Kompetenz)' and cites supporting precedents (First Options, BG Group) and scholarly views (Born) confirming that arbitrators, not courts, rule on jurisdiction first. Therefore, the response satisfies the requirement by correctly applying the competence-competence principle and does not commit the error described in the criterion.", "criterion_id": "9495db3e-2861-45da-a1e2-0b1f7bdac2f6"}
